intro: Rubus edulis, commonly known as blackberry, is a shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which are typically trifoliate. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small drupes, which are collectively known as berries. These fruits are rich in antioxidants and are widely cultivated for their flavor and nutritional value. Rubus edulis thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along hedgerows.
